author: system
content:
Anon steps to his apartment after a long day at the Minneapolis airport observing security protocol, ensuring nothing nefarious or otherwise impermissible boards a plane without first having satisfied the toll. He looks either way down the hall of the fifty seventh floor, making sure no one is looking too closely while he fumbles his keys and makes his way through the door, cracking it open and closing it behind himself before grasping for and flicking the light switch.

There, sitting on the couch of his small one room apartment, as always, is Agita. She is wrapped in a cozy blanket facing the ancient television, a display so old it rendered not against glass but instead against a black pane.
